  • Element
org.sureassert.uc.annotation

Annotation Type UseCase


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value={METHOD,CONSTRUCTOR})
public @interface UseCase
    Identifies a method that should be tested and specifies test data and optionally stubs and/or an expected result.

    Simple Invocation Notation

    Simple Invocation Notation (SIN) is used within UseCases to specify objects to use when invoking methods and evaluating results.
    When nesting SIN types the nested type must be bracketed by [].
    e.g. for a map of string to list of integers:
    m:'key1'=[l:1,2,3], 'key2'=[l:4,5,6]


    SIN Types

  • 'str' or str:str = String type = new String("str")
  • true or b:true = boolean true
  • false or b:false = boolean false
  • 1 or i:1 = integer type = 1 (integer)
  • d:1.5, 1.5 = double type = 1.5 (double)
  • float:1.5 or 1.5f = float type = 1.5f (float)
  • lg:1 or 1l = long type = 1l (long)
  • short:1 or 1s = short type = 1 (short)
  • l:1,2,3 = list type = new ArrayList containing Integers 1, 2 and 3.
  • m:'key1'=1,'key2'=2 = HashMap type = new HashMap containing string keys key1 and key2 mapped to integers 1 and 2 respectively.
  • s:1,2,3 = HashSet type = new HashSet containing Integers 1, 2 and 3.
  • a:'x','y','z' = Object array type = new String[3]{"x", "y", "z"}
  • pa:1,2,3 = primitive array type = new int[3]{1,2,3}
  • ea:[d:] = empty primitive array type of given type = new double[] {}
  • f:resources/test.xml = File type = new File("resources/test.xml"), relative from project root
  • sf:resources/test.xml = String from File type = contents of file resources/test.xml, relative from project root, as a String
  • sl:1,2,3 = Stub expression list type = special list type used to define stub invocation results.


    SIN Expressions

  • instanceA or ni:instanceA = named instance "instanceA". However by convention names should be in the format "ClassA/instanceA"
  • ClassA/xyz = named instance "ClassA/xyz"
  • ClassA/useCaseA! = Re-execute UseCase named "ClassA/useCaseA" and return the value it returns
  • ClassA/useCaseA!123 = named instance "ClassA/useCaseA!123" if it exists. Otherwise re-execute and return value returned by UseCase named "ClassA/useCaseA", and store value as "ClassA/useCaseA!123"
  • retval = return value of UseCase
  • this = the instance of this class used by this UseCase
  • namedInstance = value of a named instance i.e. a UseCase or NamedInstance name
  • MyClass1 = MyClass1.class, where MyClass1 is any source class within a Sureassert-active project in the workspace
  • mypackage/mysubpackage/MyClass1 = mypackage.mysubpackage.MyClass1.class (any class on project classpath)
  • MyClass.field1 = value of static field on class
  • this.field1 = value of field on the UseCase's instance
  • MyClass.staticMethod(arg1, arg2) = value of static method invoked on class
  • namedInstance.method(arg1, arg2) = value of method invoked on instance
  • method(arg1, arg2) = value of method invoked on this instance i.e. this.method(arg1, arg2)
  • new MyClass(arg1, arg2) = new instance of class
  • new MyClass(arg1, arg2) {field1=val1, field2=val2} = new instance of class, with some fields set to values.
  • new MyClass(arg).method(arg).field = value of field on return value of method invoked on new class.
  • retval.equals('a string with [']with quotes['] and /[square brackets/] and a single // forward-slash') = Example of escaping: evaluates to: a string with 'with quotes' and [square brackets] and a single / forward-slash'.
  • * (in args) = Generate default implementation of interface or abstract class argument and pass as argument.
  • *MyInterface = Generated default implementation of MyInterface (MyInterface must have been declared for default implementation generation using defaultimpls)


    Operators

    The following built-in method symbols should be used to replace java operators in SIN expressions:

  • =(a,b) = (a==null && b==null) || (a!=null && a.equals(b))
  • ==(a,b) = a == b
  • !=(a,b) = a != b
  • isa(a,b) = a instanceof b where b is a class e.g. MyClass or java/io/File
  • >(a,b) = a > b
  • <(a,b) = a < b
  • >=(a,b) = a >= b
  • <=(a,b) = a <= b
  • !(a) = !o
  • &(a,b) or &&(a,b) = a && b
  • |(a,b) or ||(a,b) = a || b
  • +(a,b) = append two strings
  • #(a,n) = a[n] where a is an array and n is an element index
  • #=(a,b) = deep array value equality i.e. Arrays.deepEquals(a, b) where a and b are arrays


Since:
1.0
Author:
Nathan Dolan

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract java.lang.String name
        If set, for non-void methods, the name to assign the instance returned by this UseCase.
        The named instance returned by this UseCase is available for use by any other UseCases within the workspace.

        Alternatively, rather than use the returned instance itself, other UseCases may use the ucName! notation to re-run the UseCase named ucName and use the new instance returned by the re-run.

        By convention, names should be of the format Clazz/name where Clazz is the simple name of the class on which the UseCase is defined, and name is a unique name within that class.
        Default:
        ""

      • n

        public abstract java.lang.String n
        Shorthand for name
        Default:
        ""

      • description

        public abstract java.lang.String description
        An optional free-text description of this UseCase for documentation purposes.
        Default:
        ""

      • d

        public abstract java.lang.String d
        Shorthand for description
        Default:
        ""

      • args

        public abstract java.lang.String[] args
        The arguments to pass to the method; one SIN value/expression per argument.
        Default:
        {}

      • a

        public abstract java.lang.String[] a
        Shorthand for args
        Default:
        {}

      • instance

        public abstract java.lang.String instance
        An expression returning an instance on which this UseCase will be invoked.

        It must be an instance assignable to the class or interface in which this UseCase is declared. Use ucName! notation to re-execute a named UseCase (typically defined on a constructor) to return a new instance.

        Only one of instance and depends can be specified.
        Default:
        ""

      • i

        public abstract java.lang.String i
        Shorthand for instance
        Default:
        ""

      • depends

        public abstract java.lang.String[] depends
        A list of names of UseCases on which this UseCase depends, used to order execution of UseCases where it is necessary to override the default execution order calcaulted by the Sureassert UC engine. These UseCases will be executed in the specified order before execution of this UseCase. Generally, specifying this is not necessary or desirable.

        This UseCase will be invoked on the instance on which the last UseCase in the depends list was invoked.

        Note any dependencies implied by references from the UseCase definition or annotated method are determined automatically and do not need to be explicitly declared here.

        Only one of instance and depends can be specified.
        Default:
        {}

      • expect

        public abstract java.lang.String[] expect
        Expressions to evaluate against the value returned by the method, each a boolean SIN Expression.

        If evaluating the return value the expression =(retval, <expr>) may be replaced by the shorthand <expr>. I.e. if the return value is not a boolean or a class (or the expression itself is a boolean literal), =(retval, <expr>) is assumed.
        If the return value is a class, the expression defaults to isa(retval, <expr>).
        If empty returns true.

        Optionally the notation 'failure message':expectExpr can be used where 'failure message' is a message to use in the error marker if expectExpr evaluates to false.
        Default:
        {}

      • e

        public abstract java.lang.String[] e
        Shorthand for expect
        Default:
        {}

      • expectexception

        public abstract java.lang.String expectexception
        The simple class name of an Exception that is expected to be thrown by this UseCase.
        Default:
        ""

      • ee

        public abstract java.lang.String ee
        Shorthand for expectexception
        Default:
        ""

      • verify

        public abstract java.lang.String[] verify
        A list of method invocations that are expected to be executed under the UseCase. The expression used is the same as is used for the matcher element (left-hand-side) of stubs expressions.

        For example to verify that method Foo.bar(int) was invoked, specify:
        Foo.bar(int) or omit the param to match any method with this name.

        To match only invocations with a value of less than 5, specify:
        Foo.bar(<(arg,5)).
        Default:
        {}

      • v

        public abstract java.lang.String[] v
        Shorthand for verify
        Default:
        {}

      • instanceout

        public abstract java.lang.String instanceout
        A name to assign the instance on which the UseCase is executed, post-execution. Other UseCases may then reference this instance thereby implicitly declaring a dependency on this UseCase, i.e. the instance returned is always the instance state after execution of this UseCase.
        Default:
        ""

      • io

        public abstract java.lang.String io
        Shorthand for instanceout
        Default:
        ""

      • before

        public abstract java.lang.String[] before
        A list of SIN Expressions to execute before executing this UseCase.

        The before expressions are executed between fetching the instance and executing the method-under-test. Therefore the this named instance is available for use, but retval and $argN are not.
        Default:
        {}

      • after

        public abstract java.lang.String[] after
        A list of SIN Expressions to execute after executing this UseCase.

        All named instances available to expect expressions are available to the after expressions.
        Default:
        {}

      • stubs

        public abstract java.lang.String[] stubs
        A list of method or source stub definitions. Stubs are defined as either:

      • Source stubs: sourceStubVar=expression, where sourceStubVar is the name of a source stub variable defined in-line within code comments of any class executed under the UseCase. expression is a SIN Expression that replaces the implementation of the stubbed method.
      • Method stubs: signature=expression, where signature is the signature of the method to be stubbed and expression is a SIN Expression that replaces the implementation of the stubbed method.


        Method stubs can also be defined as signature=[sl:expression], in order for a method to be assigned a "stub list" of expressions to be used as return values of the stubbed method. The items in the list are iterated for each invocation of the stubbed method by the UseCase. Where the number of invocations exceeds the number of stub expressions in the list, the last defined stub expression is used.

        Use signature^=exceptionExpression or [sl:exceptionExpression] to throw an exception from the stubbed method, where exceptionExpression is an expression which evaluates to an exception throwable from the stubbed method.

        Method signatures are defined as class.method, class.method() or class.method(arg1class, ..., argNclass) where:
      • class is the simple or fully-qualified class name of the stubbed method. Fully-qualified names must use / as the package separator rather than .
      • method is the name of the method to stub and
      • optionally argXclass is the simple or fully-qualified class name of each argument of the stubbed method. Note that methods are matched based on whether the classes of arguments passed at runtime are assignable to the specified argument classes.

        If the class.method notation is used, the stub expression will be applied to all methods with the given name.
Default:
{}

  • s

    public abstract java.lang.String[] s
    Shorthand for stubs
    Default:
    {}

  • vstubs

    public abstract java.lang.String[] vstubs
    Specifies stubs as per stubs. However stubs specified with vstubs must be invoked during UseCase execution in order for the UseCase to pass. Effectively vstubs are treated as both stubs and verify expressions.
    Default:
    {}

  • vs

    public abstract java.lang.String[] vs
    Short-hand for vstubs
    Default:
    {}

  • defaultimpls

    public abstract java.lang.String[] defaultimpls
    A list of fully-qualified class names of interfaces or abstract classes for which a default implementation will be created. The generated default implementation can be referenced elsewhere using the *simpleClassName notation, e.g. to use a new instance of the generated class, specify new *simpleClassName()
    Default:
    {}

  • template

    public abstract java.lang.String[] template
    One or more UseCase names from which properties will be copied over to this UseCase.

    The named UseCase must be in the same source file as this UseCase.

    Use the template property to take an existing UseCase definition and modify it - any properties defined by this UseCase will override the template one.

    If you define a property using an empty string or array, you will override the template property with nothing, i.e. remove the template-defined property from this UseCase.

    If you specify multiple template UseCases, properties from each template will override those from subsequently defined templates. For example, properties defined in the first given template will override those defined in the second.
    Default:
    {}

  • t

    public abstract java.lang.String[] t
    Short-hand for template
    Default:
    {}

  • debug

    public abstract java.lang.String[] debug
    A number of SIN expressions that the user wishes to be evaluated for debug purposes.
    Default:
    {}
